name: Lidocaine

indications.text: lidocaine ointment usp , 5 % indicated production anesthesia accessible mucous membranes oropharynx . also useful anesthetic lubricant intubation temporary relief pain associated minor burns , including sunburn , abrasions skin , insect bites .

contraindications.text: lidocaine ointment usp , 5 % used concomitantly products containing lidocaine , total dose contributed formulations must kept mind .

warningsAndPrecautions: ndc 17856-3008-01 lidocaine ointment usp , 5 % 1 g topical . eyes rx keep medications reach children .
adverseReactions: lidocaine contraindicated patients known history hypersensitivity local anesthetics amide type components lidocaine ointment usp , 5 % .
indications_original:
Lidocaine Ointment USP, 5% is indicated for production of anesthesia of accessible mucous membranes of the oropharynx.
                  It is also useful as an anesthetic lubricant for intubation and for the temporary relief of pain associated with minor burns, including sunburn, abrasions of the skin, and insect bites.
contraindications_original: When Lidocaine Ointment USP, 5% is used concomitantly with other products containing lidocaine, the total dose contributed by all formulations must be kept in mind.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
NDC 17856-3008-01
                  Lidocaine Ointment USP, 5% 1 g
                  FOR TOPICAL USE ONLY. 
    DO NOT USE IN THE EYES
 
                  Rx only
                  Keep this and all medications out of the reach of children.
adverseReactions_original: Lidocaine is contraindicated in patients with a known history of hypersensitivity to local anesthetics of the amide type or to other components of Lidocaine Ointment USP, 5%.
